headline: CNN This Morning
subHeadline: Disney Closes Splash Mountain; Segun Oduolowu is Interviewed about the Oscar Nominations. Aired 8:30-9a ET

utterances.speaker: HARRY ENTEN, CNN SENIOR DATA REPORTER
utterances.sentences: Of any type. Of any type. But the big, moderate fans are 12 percent. So basically you have a dislike Ticketmaster and you upset the wrong crowd. And the result of that is that Senate hearing that we have later today, guys.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: We learn something new every day.Thank you, Harry Enten.

utterances.speaker: ENTEN
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Appreciate that.

utterances.speaker: POPPY HARLOW, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Harry.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Disney World's Splash Mountain has officially been shut down after an outcry calling out the ride for being inspired by an old Disney movie that uses racial stereotypes, but still some critics are saying Disney made the wrong call. We're going to discuss, next.(COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I just wanted to say, like - whoo, for you.

utterances.speaker: AUDIE CORNISH, CNN ANCHOR AND CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: It's a lot in general.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes. And - look -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: But there's a lot there.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Yes, the culture wars are exhausting. They are. They are.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: It's a ride.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: I mean, look, maybe there's going to be this big movement that's justice for Splash Mountain. But the truth is, Disney is in this, you know, got caught up in the culture wars the last couple of years. And right as the company is making sure to refocus on parks, which is the big revenue generator, you have this kind of issue coming up putting them back in the news, which is not ideal.I hesitate to engage on the whole "Song of the South" part of it because I feel like it's practically an American pastime to kind of justify the legacy and history of things related to this Civil War. I mean it's -- that is actually part of the history and aftermath of the war itself is this romanticization of anything connected to it. You guys are probably more into Disney World than I am. I mean do you -- is this like that?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I'm not. No, no, no.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I - I told you I'm taking the kids.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: OK, tell me, is this the most exciting splash you can do there?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I've been like once. I went last year with the kids, but we're going again soon.I'm interested in how you think, big picture, like, you talk about Disney focusing on the parks and being really lucrative. They've got a new guy in charge again. The old guy is back. He's not old, but, you know, the former CEO, Bob Iger, is back.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: And I think it's going to be really interesting to see how he deals with these culture wars with Ron DeSantis because he was really outspoken on this, you know, the sort of broader issue when Florida went after Disney about a year ago then Bob Chapek was. Do you think new management changes things?

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: I mean it will be interesting to see how they try and walk the line.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Disney has done so much in the last few decades to really modernize its programming and the stories it's telling children, the way it presents families and ideas about families. That's very disruptive to people who see it fundamentally as a legacy brand and as something that is supposed to kind of look the same forever, you know what I mean? Like, Mickey Mouse always looks the same basically. And I think that seeing this pushback now has been very jarring for them. And it will be interesting to see how this boss comes back to it.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You can keep Mickey Mouse and do important things, like one of our favorite movies in our household is Disney's more recent "Princess and the Frog." And it is important for our children to see that diversity in these princesses. Come on.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Yes. And, you know, I think, again, this --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: But that's the key, I think.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: What? What?

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: That's the key, it is moving forward and doing characters that are more diverse.So, listen, I have a - I think I have a --

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: So, you're saying, would they be fighting about it if the Splash Mountain wasn't moving to a film that was POC centered?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So, this is what -- I feel very similarly, as I felt about "Gone with the Wind." So, we were talking about DeSantis and this whole idea. This is why you should be teaching these things, right, in schools.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I think that this can be a teachable moment. I hate that cliche, but I think you can keep Splash Mountain and whatever it was based on and then teach kids about it. Look, Splash Mountain, no one -- you don't have to go to Splash Mountain. But kids have to go to a school. I would prefer that my kids not go to a school named Robert E. Lee. I would prefer the name to come off of it. But for a ride that is voluntary that you're going to go there for and it has a history, you can leave it and teach kids there and say, look, this ride was created around this movie, which was a stereotype of black, you know, whatever, and I think that -- CORNISHmedia for teachable moments, unfortunately. I mean that - that's not how this works.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes, but you don't have to go to Disney.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: No one is going to be at Splash Mountain thinking about like eyes on the prize or something. Like, it's a dopey ride.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I - yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm just -- for me it's just a solution that if you want to keep Splash Mountain the way it is, again, it is voluntary. It is an amusement park.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: The long list of things people want to keep the way it is gets longer and longer, right? I mean that -- that is part of this issue, right? Like, time marches on. There's plenty of things that we don't do anymore, including Vaudeville. But this idea now that there are like these certain traditions that only certain people get to pick and choose which ones we should keep, it's pervasive and it's exhausting.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: But don't you think - I mean it is -- it depends on what it is. Like, it should be case by case, don't you think? Isn't not - there's not like a --

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Yes, but who's in -- who decides?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I think we decide.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Well, it sounds like people with petitions decide.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I think, you know, we were talking about the change.org -

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: But, I mean, what is change.org mean to anybody?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: They said like 20 - what was it, that 21,000 signatures to change it.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: But change.org is any - I mean they could - someone could just go on and keep voting and voting and voting. So it doesn't really matter. What does change.org mean?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes. I'm not a - I --

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Yes. No, change.org is important. I'm just saying that I think sometimes when we get riled up in these debates we have to say to ourselves, what is this really about? Who's really behind it? And how much of a difference does it make to our material lives?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So, you think Splash Mountain makes that much of a difference?

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: I'm saying people splash away. It's fine.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes, line up in the morning.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: And if you need to put on headphones and play "Song of the South" to enjoy that ride, you get your life, you know. But I don't really think that that is a hill you want to die on.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I do watch some of the cartoons and I'm like it's very - it's cringy. Very cringy.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I watched "Peter Pan" with the kids and I was like -

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: That's a whole other debate. I mean I won't be playing "Dumbo" in my house.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: But, I mean, Disney knows that, right?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: That's why they have made the changes they have.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Thank - thank you, Audie.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you. (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Someone messaged me after your last segment with us in the 6

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Oh, thank you. Thank you. Thank you. Check is in the mail.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Gift to the world.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: It is.You can listen - Audie's a gift to your ears, too. You can listen to her podcast, "The Assignment with Audie Cornish." It's available wherever you get your pods. Academy Award nominations just announced. We'll show you who's up for Hollywood's biggest awards, just ahead.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Oh, boy. And a 21-year-old diver rescued hours after a current swept him awayfrom his family in the Florida Keys. You're going to want to see this. You're going to hear from him for the first time.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Can't wait for you to see --

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I love this - I love this next story.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You should read it.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I - no, no, no, go for it.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You should do it.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: No, no, I'll react. I'll react.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: This morning's moment. He was lost at sea until his family showed up shouting his name. A 21-year-old free diver was swept away by a current in Key West, Florida, last week, prompting a frantic rescue mission. Here's the moment his family found him after he had been missing for hours in the north Atlantic.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Wow.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There he is!

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Dylan!

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That's him!

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Dylan!(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: That is Dylan Gartenmayer. He grew up on the Florida waters. His family believes those years of experience saved his life. He was free diving last Thursday when he felt himself being taken by a strong current. By the time he resurfaced, the current had quickly drifted him far from the boat.His two friends never saw him come back up. They got word to his family, who jumped in a boat, raced to the coordinates where Dylan was last seen. His cousin tells CNN, quote, the first thought was that he blacked out while diving and drowned. The worst feeling I've ever had. She added, everything was silent on that boat until the flashlight hit him and he put up his hands and we finally knew he was OK. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God!

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Dylan!

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God!

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, God!

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God, that was amazing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God, Dylan!(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I love the water. And I can imagine - and I know the currents can be crazy, right, because something can go wrong in just an instant in the water. But can you imagine hours without seeing --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: No, I can't.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: But I think it was really smart. Obviously, he is more adept at navigating the waters than I am. He went -- they found him near a buoy. And I wonder if he was there, that buoy was helping him stay afloat.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Oh, like going to be -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: You can see the - the - like the big white balls in the water there.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And I wonder if he was very -- he was near them. So, I'm wondering if he was kind of hanging on to those buoys or near the buoy to help. If you look, you can see that, but -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Someone - someone was on his side, that's for sure.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: See them right there?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So, I mean they ran to the back of that boat and helped him on, and I would have been doing the same thing. That is amazing. I'm so happy for him. Congratulations to him and his entire family.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: So happy for him.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Great story.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Now this.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Oh, you were thinking of my daughter. Thanks. Thanks.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I was. I was like, Poppy, does that cross your mind when you say that?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: When I - or when I type - yes, well, when I text Sienna into a text, my husband's like, hey, babe, can you get Sienna, it types CNN.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I think that means I work too much.Well, this is really exciting.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes, the Academy Award nominations just dropped moments ago. We're going to break down all the major categories, next.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) LADY GAGA, MUSICIAN (singing): So cry tonight, but don't you let go of my hand. You can cry every last tear. (END VIDEO CLIP) (COMMERCIAL BREAK) (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Now, next up, the nominees for the best documentary feature film."All that Breathes." "All the Beauty and the Bloodshed." "Fire of Love." "A House Made of Splinters." And, "Navalny." (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: So exciting.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: It was a year of big directors, big stars and big sequels for Hollywood. And now several block busters are contenders to win Hollywood's highest honor with familiar names like "Top Gun," "Avatar," "Black Panther" returning to theaters and shattering box office records. Indy films like "The Banshees of Inisherin" and "Everything Everywhere All at Once" breaking out and earning major recognition.So, let's talk about the nominations here with entertainment journalist Segun Oduolowu.

utterances.speaker: SEGUN ODUOLOWU, ENTERTAINMENT JOURNALIST
utterances.sentences: There it is.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Shoots. I have to do that every time.

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: No, you were great.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Good to see you.

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: But before we talk about these movies, like, are we cool with Colbert? Because I - I wore my - I wore my hood. Like, I'm not playing. Like, you don't come for the GOAT.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh, is this happening? Like -

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, no, like, like, if there's still smoke, we've got - we're ready. I'm riding with Don Lemon.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: What is this?

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: This is all in good fun.

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: I ride with Don Lemon. OK.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I like it. I - what were you going to do?

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: I'm just saying, like, whatever you want. I have him. We got to go (ph).

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I thought you were going to put your hood up. It's hilarious.

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, but I'm ready whenever they're ready. LEMONfun.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Funness (ph).

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you. But I'm glad you're a -- a lot of people said they wore the hoodies just because of the thing. We started a new trend.

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: Yes, absolutely. We've got to let them know. Hollywood - you know how Hollywood is.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So, let's talk about why we're here. "Navalny" winning - so what did you make of what you've heard so far of the nomination?

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: Well, so, if you look at the Academy Awards right now and you look at what this show is going to be, you see a knee-jerk reaction to first the hashtag #oscarssowhite, but what happened in 2022. A lot of these nominees and even the people that are going to run the award show, it's, you know, Jimmy Kimmel is hosting again this year, right? So, we had Will Packer. We had the first ever black production and director. You had female hosts. And now because of maybe the Will Smith slap, it is a reversal. You're going back to something tried and true. And you see that even in the movies that are nominated. There's not as much diversity as we would like.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: "Top Gun," "Avatar," "Black Panther."

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: Right, blockbusters, true.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: But when you - when you look at the names, right, we want Angela Bassett, right? Will the queen finally get her due? But it's Angela Bassett and Viola Davis. Like, these are African American women whose names we are familiar with and it doesn't seem that the Academy stretched itself really. It's still a lot of the same. There's a bio pic with Austin Butler in "Elvis." There is a comeback with Brendan Frazier and "The Whale." It's basically paint by numbers again.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Huh, paint by numbers.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes, I'm looking at these. It's -- it used to be like, in the old days, back in my day, like the people who were nominated and the films, you'd know every single one of them.

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: Absolutely. Right.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: I'm looking at this and I'm like, well, I know "Top Gun," "Elvis" I kind of know, but like all of these other -- "Avatar," obviously, I know But I don't - like "Everything Everywhere All at Once." I'm like, what?

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: Yes, no, that is -- that is Michelle Yeoh. It is a - it is a fantastic concept.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: It's a concept (ph). ODUOLOWU

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Like "Top Gun." Got a nod.

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: Like "Top Gun." "Avatar." These are huge movies, right? These are huge movies with huge box office and that -- if you're a fan of the movies, that's what you want to see. You want there to be what you like as well as the art house flicks.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: So they opened it up. Is that why they're like - because it used to be like four or five, right?

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: There's more.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And now I'm like, wow, this is a ton of films. Like --

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: And - but let's think of that for a moment. They open it up for way more movies and we still don't get the diversity in film. The same directors that we've heard for decades, Spielberg, Baz Luhrmann, McDonagh, like, these are people that have been nominated before or their movies have won before. There's very few new even as they open it up to more slots.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: And the Academy Awards are so important, obviously, for the capital gains in terms of how much more money films make and they can say -- but they're also really important because people will watch a nominated film that they might not watch before.So, I think of our film, CNN film, "Navalny." The impact it has already had given this moment, Russia's war on Ukraine, given the imprisonment and dire health of Navalny himself, the fact that this has an Academy Award nod is huge for how many more people will see this and learn his story.

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: Hopefully people will see it. I agree with you, Poppy, 100 percent, that if the award still had the glitter and the glam that they should, then this documentary will open eyes. But what we've seen is that that gold statue is not necessarily a golden ticket to eyeballs and those films and those actors and actresses even getting more work. I mean we think of Halle Berry winning an Oscar for "Monsters Ball," and --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I'll never forget that speech, that dress, all of that.

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: And - but we don't see her getting the type of roles that an Oscar-winning actress should receive. And you see that a lot, unfortunately, with the Academy.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: Adrian Brody. I can go name for name.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes, I've got to say, though, I've got to see "Everything Everywhere All at Once" because I love Jamie Lee Curtis, right?

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: Yes, she's -

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: And I love her, so I'm going to go see that.But I have just one question before I go, and maybe there's no answer -

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You've got 10 seconds they told us we have.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Is that Angela Bassett -- does she ever age? I want to have whatever she's having.

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: Whatever - whatever deal Angela made with the higher ups and by higher ups I mean the people upstairs, please tell me because I need that.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Segun.

utterances.speaker: ODUOLOWU
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: That was fun.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Thank you for being here.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Good luck to everybody.
